attractions.name: Louvre Museum
attractions.description: The world's largest art museum and a historic monument housing nearly 38,000 objects from prehistory to the 21st century.

attractions.name: Eiffel Tower
attractions.description: A wrought-iron lattice tower named after engineer Gustave Eiffel, a global cultural icon of France.

attractions.name: Musée d'Orsay
attractions.description: A museum housed in the former Gare d'Orsay railway station, known for its collection of impressionist art.

attractions.name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
attractions.description: A medieval Catholic cathedral on the Île de la Cité known for its French Gothic architecture.

attractions.name: Luxembourg Gardens
attractions.description: A 25-hectare park known for its lawns, tree-lined promenades, flowerbeds, and the Medici Fountain.

attractions.name: Le Marais
attractions.description: A historic district with many preserved medieval buildings and trendy shops, galleries, and restaurants.

attractions.name: Sainte-Chapelle
attractions.description: A royal chapel within the medieval Palais de la Cité, known for its stunning stained glass windows.

attractions.name: Montmartre & Sacré-Cœur
attractions.description: A large hill in Paris's 18th arrondissement known for its artistic history and the Sacré-Cœur Basilica.

attractions.name: Le Comptoir du Relais
attractions.description: A popular bistro serving classic French dishes in Saint-Germain-des-Prés.

attractions.name: Sagrada Família
attractions.description: A large unfinished Roman Catholic basilica designed by Catalan architect Antoni Gaudí.

attractions.name: Park Güell
attractions.description: A public park system composed of gardens and architectural elements designed by Antoni Gaudí.

attractions.name: Casa Batlló
attractions.description: A building redesigned by Antoni Gaudí, known for its unique skeletal, visceral quality.

attractions.name: La Rambla
attractions.description: A famous street in central Barcelona, popular with tourists and locals for its market stalls and street performers.

attractions.name: Picasso Museum
attractions.description: A museum dedicated to the work of Pablo Picasso, housing one of the most extensive collections of artworks by the painter.

attractions.name: Barceloneta Beach
attractions.description: A sandy beach in the Barceloneta neighborhood, featuring seafood restaurants and beach activities.

attractions.name: Mercat de la Boqueria
attractions.description: A large public market with a diverse selection of produce, food, and dining.

attractions.name: Tickets Bar
attractions.description: A modern tapas bar offering innovative, molecular gastronomy-inspired dishes.

attractions.name: Colosseum
attractions.description: An oval amphitheatre in the centre of the city, the largest ancient amphitheatre ever built.

attractions.name: Vatican Museums
attractions.description: Christian and art museums within the Vatican City, displaying works from the vast collection amassed by the Roman Catholic Church.

attractions.name: St. Peter's Basilica
attractions.description: An Italian Renaissance church in Vatican City, the papal enclave within Rome.

attractions.name: Trevi Fountain
attractions.description: A famous fountain in Rome, known for the tradition of throwing coins over one's shoulder into the water.

attractions.name: Pantheon
attractions.description: A former Roman temple, now a church, featuring the world's largest unreinforced concrete dome.

attractions.name: Roman Forum
attractions.description: A rectangular forum surrounded by the ruins of several important ancient government buildings at the center of Rome.

attractions.name: Villa Borghese Gardens
attractions.description: A large public park containing the Borghese Gallery and Museum, featuring one of the world's best collections of sculptures.

attractions.name: Da Enzo al 29
attractions.description: A small, family-run restaurant serving authentic Roman cuisine.

attractions.name: Rijksmuseum
attractions.description: A Dutch national museum dedicated to arts and history, featuring works by Rembrandt and Vermeer.

attractions.name: Anne Frank House
attractions.description: A biographical museum dedicated to Jewish wartime diarist Anne Frank.

attractions.name: Van Gogh Museum
attractions.description: A museum dedicated to the works of Vincent van Gogh and his contemporaries.

attractions.name: Vondelpark
attractions.description: A public urban park of 47 hectares, featuring an open-air theatre, playgrounds, and several cafes.

attractions.name: Canal Tour
attractions.description: A boat tour through Amsterdam's historic canal ring area, designated as a UNESCO World Heritage site.

attractions.name: Jordaan
attractions.description: A former working-class area transformed into a trendy neighborhood with art galleries, shops, and restaurants.

attractions.name: Foodhallen
attractions.description: An indoor food market with various food stalls offering international cuisines.
